title: Saliou Diallo
text:
Saliou Diallo (born 3 November 1976) is a retired <a href="Guinea">Guinea</a>n <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Career.
Diallo started his career at <a href="Hafia%20Football%20Club">Hafia</a> in 1994 before moving to <a href="K.M.S.K.%20Deinze">Deinze</a> in Belgium in 1997. Diallo signed for <a href="K.V.C.%20Westerlo">Westerlo</a> in 1998 before moving to Turkey in 1999 with <a href="Gaziantepspor">Gaziantepspor</a> for a season. Diallo spent two seasons with <a href="Yimpa%C5%9F%20Yozgatspor">Yimpaş Yozgatspor</a> before signing for <a href="Diyarbak%C4%B1rspor">Diyarbakırspor</a> for a season and then moved to <a href="Azerbaijan">Azerbaijan</a> with <a href="Shamkir%20FK">Shamkir</a>. Diallo stayed at Shamkir for a season and a half before moving to <a href="FK%20Genclerbirliyi%20Sumqayit">Genclerbirliyi Sumqayit</a> in 2005 where he made 50 league appearances before retiring in 2007.
International career.
Diallo was a member of the <a href="Guinea%20national%20football%20team">Guinean</a> squad's that went to the <a href="1994%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">1994</a> and <a href="1998%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">1998</a> <a href="African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">African Cup of Nations</a>.
